text.p: United Wisconsin Services Inc said its shareholders at a special meeting Wednesday approved the acquisition of American Medical Security Group.
American Medical Security holders approved the merger transaction last week.

United Wisconsin said substantially all of the business formerly conducted by American Medical Security will be operated by American Medical Security Holdings Inc, a wholly owned United Wisconsin subsidiary.
As previously reported, United Wisconsin paid $67 million in cash and 3,694,280 in newly issued shares of its stock.

In connection with the merger, United Wisconsin said Samuel Miller will be president and chief executive officer of American Medical Security Holdings. He currently serves as executive vice president of United Wisconsin.

Wallace Hilliard and Ronald Weyers, founders and major shareholders of American Medical Security, will serve as directors of American Medical Security Holdings. Hilliard will become its chairman and Weyers, vice chairman.
American Medical Security Holdings administers health plans underwritten by United Wisconsin Life Insurance Co and United Wisconsin Insurance Co.
